Day of Defeat: Source

Habe Day of Defeat: Source als Geschenk bekommen. Es macht alleine und mit Freunden riesigen Spaß. Die Grafik ist top und die Steuerung einfach zu lernen. Waffen ziehen extrem hoch. Für mich noch immer eins der besten WWII Spiele. Wer an WWII Shooter interessiert ist, sollte Day of Defeat: Source ausprobieren. 1+ Killing Teabags 9/10

Its quite cool, but I would say its already old for the genre. A little bit sad, but if you want a classic WW2 deathmatch games there are better games out there. Good for some nostalgia and to sometimes pass your time with friends tho!

Day of Defeat: Source jest grą multiplayer stworzona przez Valve (Gabena). Gra zostala osadzona w realiach II wojny światowej, na froncie zachodnim. W grze jesteśmy zółnierzem Armi USA albo Państw Osi (Wehrmacht) i postacie są podzielone na klasy takie jak: Strzelec, Szturmowiec, Żołnierz wsparcia, Operator KM, Rakietowiec i Snajper. 

Strzelec jest uzbrojony w M1 Garand\Kar 98, pistolet - colt m1911\ Walter P38, w nóż\saperka i posiada nasadkowy granatnik. W M1 Garand i w Kar 98 mamy opjce spojrzenia przez muszkę i szczęrbinkę oraz zaczepienia nasadkowego granatnika. Szturmowiec posiada Thompsona (Tommygun)\MP 40, pistolet, w nóż/saperka, w granat odłamkomy\trzonkowy i w granat dymny. w Thompsonie i w MP 40 mamy opcje uderzania ręką. Żołnierz wsparcia posiada BAR\STG 44, pistolet, nóż\saperka i 2-3 granaty odłamkowe\trzonkowe. W BAR i w STG 44 mamy opcję ustawienia strzału pojedynczego lub na automatyczny. Snajper posiada springfield\Kar 98 z lunetą, pistolet, nóż\saperka. Operator KM posiada karabin maszynowy 30cal\Mg 42, pistolet, nóz\saperka. Rakietowiec posiada Bazookę\Panzerschreck, M1 carbine\Mauser C96, nóż\saperka. 

Gra działa na silniku Source, więc grafika nadal jest dobra, fizyka jest epicka, zabawne ragdolle (tzw. szmaty), ładna woda. Mapy zostały bardzo dobrze zaprojektowane, są duże, a niektóre są ogromne. Bronie wyglądają bardzo ładnie. Dźwięki broni brzmią bardzo dobrze. Postacie wyglądają dobrze i mają dobrze odzworowane mundury. 

W grze mamy takie tryby gry jak: Przejęcie flag, podkładanie bomby (Niemcy atakują, Amerykanie bronią) i jest tryb, w którym Amerykanie i Niemcy podkładają ładunki wybuchowe. Co do graczy, w grze spotkamy dużo niemieckich klanów, gracze gadają ze sobą, śmieją się i naprawdę fajnie się ich słucha. Więc w tej grze szybko nauczymy się j. niemieckiego :) . Gra na pewno wymarła, są serwery, na których jest dużo graczy, ale dużo serwerów stoi pustych. Obecnie w grę gram z dwoma znajomymi i świetnie się bawimy.

Co do minusów to na pewno brak kampanii dla jednego gracza, gdyby ta gra miałaby ten tryb to tą grę każdy zna.
Podsumowując gra jest wyśmienita, jest WEDŁUG MNIE lepsza od CS'a. Jest to gra dla tych którzy lubią gry o tematyce II wojny światowej. Bardzo polecam tą grę.
Grafika - 8.5
Grywalność - 8
Dźwięk - 10
Ocena ogólna - 9

El juego en si esta bastante bien, tiene muchos puntos positivos como negativos:

Positivos:

- No necesitas un PC de la NASA para jugarlo.

- Es realista, en el sentido de que tiene cadencia y retroceso las armas.

- Tiene Clases con diferentes armas y no tienes que andar comprando y cosas asi como en cs.

- Tiene buenos graficos dado que tiene 5 años ya el juego.

- La tematica.

Contras:

- Hay muchos servidores pero jugando gente poca... hoy por ejemplo soy hay 4 o 5 con gente.

- Hay demasiados hackers, les disparas teniendolo en frente a la cabeza, no le haces nada pero el a ti te mata, ademas de cosas similares a esa...

- No son rondas tipo CS ( para mi gusto abria sido mas interesante la verdad)

- Demasiado caro a no ser que le compres de oferta ( PVP sin rebaja 6,99€ y con rebaja 1,74€)

- Dado que hay mucho Hacker y poca gente normal, si no juegas con amigos es como hacer una partida tu solo.

Mi nota personal es un 5/10 si no hubiera hackers y los controlaran mas le daria un 8 pero como no es asi...

당신을위한 게임 - 당신은 세계 대전의 분위기에 일반 전초전을합니다. 작은 카드 포맷이 게임은 가장 역동적 수 있습니다. 그럼 당신은 지루하지 않습니다. 다른 클래스, 대상,해도 및 전략. 재생되지 않았다 얼마나 오래, 나는 거의 표시되지는 부적절하다. 이 게임의 대부분의 사용자는 - 이미 성인이다. 이 때문에 당신은 불편하지 않습니다. 이 게임에 관해서는, 많은 개조, 플레이어 모델과 무기가있다. 이 게임에 대해 좋아하지 않는 유일한 것은 당신이 기술, 탱크 또는 대공포, 또는 기존의 지프 없음을 사용할 수 없다는 것입니다. 상단의 사운드 디자인.

One of my favourite games from Childhood.
I always loved the simplicity of Source games and how it was always down to map knowledge, aim skill and time you put in.

However if you are an Australian like me there is really only one server to play on, Anzac gamer's. However the admins are a bit soft... ironic since most are ex-veterans. The idea of their server is to be fun to play with however all their moaning and calling people "bs" constantly isn't fun. It's why I left their clan when I use to just play Dod:s. However I'm once again "banned" from the server for stating " You guys have played for ages hey? You all must be really good then! ".

It was a great game and is a relic of it's time, It's a shame that the only Aus server running will also be the death of it due to Admins.
If they put more time into the game rather than crying they might improve, my mindset has always been to learn from better players.. I guess there's is to moan and cry like children.

Anyway great game but don't buy if you're Australian... most part the community is ok but the head admins make it unbearable and I've had lots of close friends banned for "hacking" which is false.

Hands down the best Source game.  I could spend all day on it.

If you enjoy multiplayer games like Counter Strike: Source and Battlefield you may be in for a treat. This game has a heeping helping of class based units on either the Allies (American Army) or the Axis (Nazi Germany's Army). Each unit has a very specific loadout. I enjoy shooting granades with my M1 Grand as a rifleman for Allies. However, equally fun is heaving around a panzshrek on my back while toting my favorite pistol the "Broom Handle" (aka the Mauser) as a German. Either way, multiplayer is every bit as fun as you can imagine for a WWII First Person Shooter (FPS). 

However, there are some drawbacks. Unlike Counter Strike: Source where if you feel more like a relaxed game of practice with some AI bots (computer controlled enemies/teammates) this game does not offer such a thing at all. No bots at all actually! Which is a huge let down when it comes to how many times gamers like to chill after a tough fight, especially if a sniper dominates, yet they still want to play too. A more relaxed offline game with bots often times left me with a built up enough confidence to get back into the fight with human players so I can give my best again. 

Also, the clunky controls for aiming and moving are a little lackluster. Some weapons do not even let you aim down the sights. This is a disappointment too. The game does compensate for such things, like the soldier carrying a Thompson may only fire from the hip, but he carries a pistol, one frag grenade, and one smoke/flash grenade. Each unit actually has there own loadout which in of itself may prove unique not only among their teammates but even between both armies. This does help keep things fresh and provides each character with more of their own advantages. 

Machine gunners and snipers seem to be the heaviest of hitters as they both rack up a lot of kills. Though a very skilled marksman in this game with a sniper rifle is the deadliest opponent yet! Rifles are ok and allow aiming down the sights. While smgs are strictly hip fire these pack a wholop at close range, which make them ideal for clearing a room but not good across open space. Bazookas are Bazookas. No shotguns can be found, but they are hardly missed. 

The matches are usually about capturing positions. Whichever team controls all the flag posts wins. Pretty straight forward and fun. Should you spend $9.99 on it? Well honestly if you have no problem with only playing online with people, love FPS games, and love the era of WWII then this is the game for you. If you do not fit into any of those, do not buy this game. 

My opinion is: It is worth checking out, but I would recommend waiting for a Valve publishers sale because it offers little in terms of offline (because no computer opponents/teammates to play with). If that is not a problem, then buy it today. 

Overall verdict: 8/10 [Cons: -Clunky controls -No offline (bots not included); Pros: -Good FPS -Brings CS:Source to WWII era -High Replay Value for FPS and/or WWII era fans]

Игра для хорошего времяпровождения вечером после работы.

I played the heck out of the HL1 mod and got pretty good at it.

Bought DoD Source and found out it took away a bunch of the weapons and made a bunch of the dark corners super bright.

It's kinda fun still, it's tainted by campers and very likely people who use aim bot, but for the most part it's pretty solid and if you can manage to find a populated server it's still very playable, despite its advanced age. 

I do miss being able to play as the British from the HL1 mod, and a lot of the weapons are absent like the M1 carbine, the M3 grease gun, the FG 42, K43,  Lee Enfield, and the Bren gun, and the Source version doesn't have quite as many maps from what I remember. I do like the alt-fire modes on many of the weapons, and the weapons feel nice and punchy like I remember, but compared to some more modern trappings, if you're looking for more realistic weapon behaviour and functionality like in Red Orchestra you may be left wanting. 

Ultimately, it's still a fun nostalgic romp from a time where you'd be surprised at what you remember if you used to be a player, but you'll also be reminded why a lot of modern FPS innovations are taken for granted these days. End up on a server against people who haven't stopped playing since this game came out and you'll probably remember why you stopped playing in the first place.

Not too unique of gameplay to make you want to play this game for a long time. The lack of an official server makes it hard to find a good server, but depending on the way you play, you can find a server fitting to your needs at almost every hour.  The graphics are ok, nothing special but nothing bad either. The class system can vary on different servers, but a lot if times certain classes have only a small amount of players being able to play them. The gameplay varies significantly between classes, for instance the rifle and sniper classes are more for long rang combat (which is not common in the urban style maps the game features, but can sometimes be found in alley ways for instance the "tank alley") while the Assualt and support classes offer a more action packed hand to hand combat expeirnce type of gameplay. All in all the game is good, featuring ok gameplay and a nice diversity of gameplay in between classes, do yourself a favor and get this game if you want to have a good WW2 multiplayer game.

You know what I realized?
This game does reward you for playing, not just for playing well. I've been playing this game for ca 8 years, and I still suck. But compared to other games where you get ridiculed and taunted by 12 year old boys, this game has got a nice, balancd gameplay and a community that embraces new players. (for the most part)
Welcome aboard.
